TEXT.French: Expansion
TEXT.Italian: Espansione
TEXT.Spanish: Expansiуn

TEXT.French: Assujettissement
TEXT.Italian: Sottomissione
TEXT.Spanish: Subyugaciуn

TEXT.Russian: [TAB]The term "subjugation" is used to describe the policy of a nation's dominance over other lands. This doctrine has been frequently employed for economic exploitation in which an imperialist power makes use of other countries as sources of raw materials and cheap labor, shaping their economies to suit its own interests and keeping their people in poverty. [PARAGRAPH:2]Sometimes subjugation even refers to the acceptance, by the colonised, of the culture or doctrines of the coloniser as intrinsically more worthy or superior.
TEXT.English: [TAB]The term "subjugation" is used to describe the policy of a nation's dominance over other lands. This doctrine has been frequently employed for economic exploitation in which an imperialist power makes use of other countries as sources of raw materials and cheap labor, shaping their economies to suit its own interests and keeping their people in poverty. [PARAGRAPH:2]Sometimes subjugation even refers to the acceptance, by the colonised, of the culture or doctrines of the coloniser as intrinsically more worthy or superior.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le terme d'Assujettissement fait référence à la politique de dominance d'une nation. Cette doctrine a souvent été employée pour l'exploitation économique d'un pays par un autre : un pouvoir impérialiste utilise d'autres pays en tant que sources de matières premières et de main-d'oeuvre bon marché, ajuste leur économie selon ses propres intérêts et maintient les gens dans la pauvreté. [PARAGRAPH:2]Parfois, l'Assujettissement fait référence à l'acceptation par les peuples colonisés de la culture ou des doctrines des colonisateurs, considérées comme meilleures ou supérieures.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Der Begriff "Unterwerfung" beschreibt die politischen Bestrebungen einer Nation, andere Länder beherrschen zu wollen. Diese Doktrin wurde häufig zur Realisierung wirtschaftlicher Ausbeutung eingesetzt, wobei die Kolonialmacht andere Länder als Quellen für seltene Rohstoffe und billige Arbeitskräfte missbrauchte, deren Wirtschaft sie dann so gestaltete, dass sie zu den eigenen Interessen passte und schlussendlich die Einheimischen in ihrer Armut beließ. [PARAGRAPH:2]Manchmal wird mit "Unterwerfung" allerdings auch der Umstand bezeichnet, dass die Kolonisierten die Kultur oder Lehren der Kolonialmacht als "wertvoller" oder "besser" akzeptieren und würdigen.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Il termine "sottomissione" viene usato per descrivere il dominio di una nazione su altre terre. Questa dottrina и stata spesso usata per lo sfruttamento economico: una potenza imperialista sfrutta altri paesi come fonti di materie prime e lavoro a basso costo, modellando le loro economie a favore dei propri interessei e mantenendone le popolazioni in povertа. [PARAGRAPH:2]Alle volte la sottomissione fa addirittura riferimento all'accettazione, da parte dei colonizzati, di una presunta e intrinseca superioritа della cultura dei colonizzatori.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]El tйrmino "subyugaciуn" se utiliza para describir la polнtica de dominio de una naciуn sobre otros territorios. Esta doctrina se ha empleado frecuentemente para describir la explotaciуn econуmica que realiza una potencia imperialista cuando utiliza a otros paнses como fuentes de materias primas y mano de obra barata, modelando sus economнas según sus propios intereses y manteniendo a sus gentes en la pobreza. [PARAGRAPH:2]A veces la subyugaciуn tambiйn alude a la aceptaciуn por parte de la colonia de la cultura o las doctrinas de la potencia colonial como intrнnsecamente superiores.

TEXT.French: Vice-royauté
TEXT.Italian: Vicereame
TEXT.Spanish: Virreinato

TEXT.Russian: [TAB]A viceroy is a royal official who governs a country or province in the name of and as representative of a monarch. The term derives from the Latin prefix vice-, meaning "in the place of" and French roi, meaning king. His province or territory is called a viceroyalty. [PARAGRAPH:2]The title was originally used by the Aragonese Crown during the 14th Century to refer to Sardinia and Corsica. The absolutist Kings of Spain employed numerous Viceroys to rule over various parts of their vast empire "where the sun never sets", both European and overseas.
TEXT.English: [TAB]A viceroy is a royal official who governs a country or province in the name of and as representative of a monarch. The term derives from the Latin prefix vice-, meaning "in the place of" and French roi, meaning king. His province or territory is called a viceroyalty. [PARAGRAPH:2]The title was originally used by the Aragonese Crown during the 14th Century to refer to Sardinia and Corsica. The absolutist Kings of Spain employed numerous Viceroys to rule over various parts of their vast empire "where the sun never sets", both European and overseas.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Un vice-roi est un représentant royal qui gouverne un pays ou une province en tant que représentant d'un monarque. Il s'agit de la personne qui agit "à la place de" ("vice-") son roi. Sa province ou son territoire est appelée vice-royauté. [PARAGRAPH:2]Ce titre était utilisé à l'origine par la Couronne d'Aragon, durant le 14e siècle, pour désigner la Sardaigne et la Corse. Les monarques espagnols nommaient de nombreux vice-rois, afin de régner sur les différentes régions de leur vaste empire, "où le soleil ne se couche jamais", en Europe et par-delà les océans.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Ein Vizekönig ist ein königlicher Würdenträger, der ein Land oder eine Provinz im Namen bzw. als Repräsentant des Königs regiert. Der Begriff ist von der lateinischen Vorsilbe "Vize" (an Stelle von) abgeleitet. Seine Provinz bzw. seine Ländereien werden Vizekönigreich genannt. [PARAGRAPH:2]Ursprünglich wurde dieser Titel seit dem 14. Jahrhundert vom Aragonischen Königshaus für Sardinien und Korsika verwendet. Die absolutistischen Könige Spaniens setzten unzählige Vizekönige ein, um die Kontrolle über weite Teile ihres riesigen Reiches, "in dem die Sonne niemals untergeht", sowohl in Europa als auch in Übersee zu sichern.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Un vicerй и un funzionario reale che governa un Paese o una provincia nel nome e come rappresentante di un monarca. Il termine deriva dal prefisso latino vice-, che significa "al posto di" e dal francese roi, che significa re. La provincia o il territorio controllato si chiama vicereame. [PARAGRAPH:2]Il titolo venne originariamente usato dalla corona di Aragona, durante il 14° secolo, in riferimento a Sardegna e Corsica. I monarchi assoluti di Spagna usarono numerosi vicerй per governare diverse parti del loro vasto impero, "su cui non tramonta mai il sole", sia in Europa che oltremare.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Un virrey es un delegado real que gobierna un paнs o una provincia en nombre de un monarca. El tйrmino deriva del latнn "vice regis", que quiere decir "en nombre del rey". Su provincia o territorio se denomina "virreinato". [PARAGRAPH:2]El tнtulo lo utilizу originalmente la corona de Aragуn durante el siglo XIV para aludir a Cуrcega y Cerdeсa. Los reyes absolutistas espaсoles emplearon numerosos virreyes para gestionar su vasto imperio, tanto europeo como de ultramar, "en el que nunca se ponнa el sol".

TEXT.French: Repeuplement
TEXT.Italian: Risistemazione
TEXT.Spanish: Reasentamiento

TEXT.Russian: [TAB]"Resettlement" literally means the transportation of a group of people to a new settlement and the populating of a new area. Although migration has featured throughout human history and prehistory, the word settler (synonymous with terms like pioneers and colonists) is often used in relation to modern or early modern history. [PARAGRAPH:2]The reason for emigration of settlers varies, but often includes one or more factors such as: personal economic hardship; social, cultural, ethnic, or religious persecution; political oppression; or policies aimed at encouraging foreign settlement.
TEXT.English: [TAB]"Resettlement" literally means the transportation of a group of people to a new settlement and the populating of a new area. Although migration has featured throughout human history and prehistory, the word settler (synonymous with terms like pioneers and colonists) is often used in relation to modern or early modern history. [PARAGRAPH:2]The reason for emigration of settlers varies, but often includes one or more factors such as: personal economic hardship; social, cultural, ethnic, or religious persecution; political oppression; or policies aimed at encouraging foreign settlement.
TEXT.French: [TAB]"Repeuplement" signifie littéralement amener un groupe de personnes dans une nouvelle implantation pour peupler une zone. Bien que la migration soit une constante de la préhistoire et de l'histoire de l'humanité, le mot colon (synonyme de pionnier) est souvent utilisé en relation avec l'histoire moderne ou contemporaine. [PARAGRAPH:2]Les raisons qui poussent à émigrer sont nombreuses, mais on retrouve souvent les difficultés économiques personnelles, les persécutions sociales, ethniques ou religieuses, l'oppression politique, ou des politiques encourageant la colonisation.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Der Begriff "Umsiedlung" beschreibt den Umzug einer Gruppe von Menschen in ein neues Siedlungsgebiet bzw. die Bevölkerung neuer Gebiete. Während es derartige "Völkerwanderungen" in der gesamten Menschheitsgeschichte gegeben hat, wird der davon abgeleitete Begriff "Siedler" (Synonym fьr Pionier und Kolonist) häufig in Bezug auf die moderne bzw. frühmoderne Geschichte verwendet. [PARAGRAPH:2]Es gibt unterschiedliche Gründe für die Ab- bzw. Auswanderung von Siedlern, meist spielen dabei jedoch folgende Faktoren eine Rolle: persönliches bzw. wirtschaftliches Elend, soziale, kulturelle, ethnische oder religiöse Verfolgung, politische Unterdrückung oder die politische Förderung fremder Siedlungen.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]"Risistemazione" sta a indicare il trasporto di un gruppo di persone in un nuovo insediamento e il popolamento di una nuova zona. Anche se le migrazioni hanno avuto luogo in tutta la storia e preistoria umana, la parola colonizzatore (o anche pioniere o colono) и spesso utilizzata in relazione alla storia moderna. [PARAGRAPH:2]Le ragioni per l'emigrazione dei coloni sono diverse, ma spesso includono uno o più fattori come: forti problemi economici; persecuzione sociale, culturale, etnica o religiosa; oppressione politica, oppure politiche che incoraggiano l'insediamento all'estero.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]El "reasentamiento" consiste en el traslado de un grupo de personas a un nuevo enclave para poblar una nueva zona. Aunque la migraciуn ha existido en toda la historia, e incluso en la prehistoria, el tйrmino colono, en ocasiones sinуnimo de pionero, se suele utilizar en contextos de la historia moderna o contemporбnea. [PARAGRAPH:2]Los motivos de la migraciуn colonial son variados, pero a menudo incluyen dos o mбs factores, como penurias econуmicas, persecuciуn social, cultural, йtnica o religiosa, opresiуn polнtica o polнticas potenciadoras de la emigraciуn o la inmigraciуn.

TEXT.French: Occupation
TEXT.Italian: Occupazione
TEXT.Spanish: Ocupaciуn

TEXT.Russian: [TAB]Belligerent military occupation occurs when one nation's military occupies all or part of the territory of another nation or recognized belligerent. [PARAGRAPH:2]In most wars some territory of the losing side is placed under the authority of the hostile army. Most military occupations end with the cessation of hostilities. In some cases the occupied territory is returned and in others the land remains under the control of the occupying power but usually not as militarily occupied territory. The latter was the case of Germany after WWII, which ended up being split into two different nations.
TEXT.English: [TAB]Belligerent military occupation occurs when one nation's military occupies all or part of the territory of another nation or recognized belligerent. [PARAGRAPH:2]In most wars some territory of the losing side is placed under the authority of the hostile army. Most military occupations end with the cessation of hostilities. In some cases the occupied territory is returned and in others the land remains under the control of the occupying power but usually not as militarily occupied territory. The latter was the case of Germany after WWII, which ended up being split into two different nations.
TEXT.French: [TAB]L'occupation militaire désigne la présence d'une armée étrangère sur tout ou partie du territoire d'une autre nation ou d'un belligérant reconnu. [PARAGRAPH:2]Dans la plupart des guerres, certains territoires du pays vaincu sont placés sous l'autorité d'une armée ennemie. La plupart des occupations militaires se terminent avec la cessation des hostilités. Dans certains cas, le territoire occupé est rendu et dans d'autres, il reste sous le contrôle de la puissance occupante, mais plus en tant que territoire occupé militairement. La dernière occupation fut celle de l'Allemagne après la Seconde Guerre mondiale, qui se termina par sa division en deux pays distincts.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Eine kriegerische militдrische Besatzung tritt dann ein, wenn die militärischen Streitkräfte einer Nation das Territorium einer anderen Nation oder eines Kriegsgegners vollständig oder teilweise besetzen. [PARAGRAPH:2]In den meisten Kriegen wurde ein Teil des Territoriums der Verliererseite der Befehlsgewalt der feindlichen Militärs unterstellt. Dabei beendeten die militдrischen Besatzungen in der Regel gleichzeitig auch die Feindseligkeiten zwischen den Kriegsparteien. In manchen Fдllen wurde das Besatzungsgebiet später wieder zurückgegeben, in anderen verblieb es in der Hand der Besatzungsmacht, normalerweise aber nicht mehr als militдrisch besetztes Territorium. Letzteres ereignete sich nach dem 2. Weltkrieg in Deutschland und endete damit, dass Deutschland bis zur Wiedervereinigung im Jahr 1990 in zwei verschiedene Staaten aufgeteilt war.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]L'occupazione militare si ha quando l'esercito di una nazione occupa tutto o parte del territorio di un'altra nazione o fazione ostile. [PARAGRAPH:2]In molte guerre parte del territorio della fazione perdente viene posto sotto l'autoritа dell'esercito ostile. La maggior parte delle occupazioni militari terminano con la cessazione delle ostilitа. In alcuni casi il territorio occupato viene restituito, mentre in altri rimane sotto il controllo della potenza occupante, anche se solitamente non come territorio occupato militarmente. Questo fu il caso della Germania dopo la Seconda Guerra Mondiale, che finм con l'essere divisa in due diverse nazioni.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]La ocupaciуn militar se produce cuando un ejйrcito beligerante de una naciуn ocupa todo o parte del territorio de otra naciуn. [PARAGRAPH:2]En muchas guerras, parte del territorio del bando derrotado es sometido a la autoridad del ejйrcito hostil. La mayor parte de las ocupaciones militares finalizan con el cese de las hostilidades. En algunos casos, el territorio ocupado es devuelto, pero en otros la zona permanece bajo control de la potencia enemiga, aunque ya no como territorio ocupado militarmente. El último fue el caso de Alemania tras la II Guerra Mundial, que acabу siendo divida entre dos naciones diferentes.

TEXT.French: Commonwealth
TEXT.Italian: Commonwealth
TEXT.Spanish: Commonwealth

TEXT.Russian: [TAB]The English noun "Commonwealth" originally dates from the fifteenth century. The term literally meant "common well-being". Thus commonwealth originally meant a state governed for the common good as opposed to an authoritarian state governed for the benefit of a given class of owners. [PARAGRAPH:2]Today the term is more general and means a political community. When capitalised, "Commonwealth" normally refers to the 53 member Commonwealth of Nations - formerly the "British Commonwealth" - a loose confederation of nations formerly members of the British Empire.
TEXT.English: [TAB]The English noun "Commonwealth" originally dates from the fifteenth century. The term literally meant "common well-being". Thus commonwealth originally meant a state governed for the common good as opposed to an authoritarian state governed for the benefit of a given class of owners. [PARAGRAPH:2]Today the term is more general and means a political community. When capitalised, "Commonwealth" normally refers to the 53 member Commonwealth of Nations - formerly the "British Commonwealth" - a loose confederation of nations formerly members of the British Empire.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le terme anglais "Commonwealth" remonte au quinzième siècle. Il signifie littéralement "bien-être de tous". Commonwealth voulait donc désigner un état gouverné pour le bien de tous, par opposition à un état autoritaire gouverné pour le bénéfice d'une certaine classe possédante. [PARAGRAPH:2]Aujourd'hui, le terme est plus général et désigne une communauté politique. Le Commonwealth fait normalement référence aux 53 nations qui faisaient à l'origine partie du Commonwealth britannique, une confédération disparate de pays issus de l'ancien empire britannique.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Der englische Begriff "Commonwealth" datiert ursprünglich aus dem 15. Jahrhundert und bedeutet wörtlich übersetzt etwa "Gemeinwohl". Er bezeichnete ursprünglich einen Staat, dessen Regierung vornehmlich auf das Wohl der Gemeinschaft abzielt, im Gegensatz zum autoritären Staat, dessen Regierung vor allem auf das Wohlergehen einer bestimmten Klasse von Grundbesitzern und sonstigen Eigentümern hinarbeitet. [PARAGRAPH:2]Heute wird der Begriff allgemeiner verwendet und beschreibt eine politische Staatengemeinschaft. Wenn man vom "Commonwealth" spricht, ist damit nun normalerweise das aus 53 Mitgliedsstaaten gebildete "Commonwealth of Nations" - ehemals "British Commonwealth" genannt - gemeint, ein freiwilliger Bund unabhängiger Staaten, die früher zum British Empire gehörten.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]La parola inglese "Commonwealth" risale al quindicesimo secolo. Il termine significava letteralmente "benessere comune". Quindi originariamente commonwealth stava a indicare uno stato governato per il bene comune, in opposizione a uno stato autoritario governato per il benessere di una data classe. [PARAGRAPH:2]Oggi il termine и più generico e indica una comunitа politica. Quando и maiuscolo, "Commonwealth" di solito si riferisce al Commonwealth delle Nazioni, composto da 53 membri e una volta conosciuto come Commonwealth britannico: una confederazione di nazioni che facevano precedentemente parte dell'impero britannico.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]El tйrmino inglйs "Commonwealth", que tiene su origen en el siglo XV, significa literalmente "bienestar común", y en sus orнgenes hacнa referencia a un tipo de estado cuyo gobierno persigue el bien común, frente a un estado autoritario que persigue el beneficio de una determinada clase social. [PARAGRAPH:2]Hoy el tйrmino es mбs general y alude a una comunidad polнtica. Cuando se escribe con mayúsculas, "Commonwealth" hace referencia a la "Commonwealth of Nations" de 53 miembros, antes denominada "British Commonwealth of Nations", una confederaciуn laxa que engloba a las naciones que pertenecieron al Imperio Britбnico.

TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]+4 points de stabilité par vassal
TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET]+4 punti stabilitа per ogni vassallo.
TEXT.Spanish: [ICON_BULLET]+4 puntos de estabilidad por cada vasallo

TEXT.Russian: [ICON_BULLET]+4 Stability Points for each civilization starting point controlled
TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET]+4 Stability Points for each civilization starting point controlled
TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]+4 points de stabilité par point de départ de civilisation contrôlé
TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET]+4 punti stabilitа per ogni punto di avvio di civiltа controllato.
TEXT.Spanish: [ICON_BULLET]+4 puntos de estabilidad por cada punto de inicio de civilizaciуn controlado

TEXT.Russian: [ICON_BULLET]+2 очка стабильности за каждый город, основанный на расстоянии не меньше 15 клеток от столицы
TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET]+2 additional Stability Points for each city founded at least 15 tiles from the capital
TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]+2 points de stabilité par ville fondée à 15 cases ou plus de la capitale
TEXT.German: [ICON_BULLET]+2 zusätzliche Stabilitätspunkte für jede Stadt, die mindestens 15 Geländefelder von der Hauptstadt entfernt gegründet wurde
TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET]+2 punti stabilitа addizionali per ogni cittа fondata ad almeno 15 caselle dalla capitale.
TEXT.Spanish: [ICON_BULLET]+2 puntos de estabilidad adicionales por cada ciudad fundada al menos a 15 casillas de la capital

TEXT.Russian: [ICON_BULLET]+2 дополнительных очка Стабильности за каждый завоеванный город
TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET]+2 additional Stability Points on city conquest
TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]+2 points de stabilité à la conquête d'une ville
TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET]+2 punti stabilitа addizionali conquistando una cittа.
TEXT.Spanish: [ICON_BULLET]+2 puntos de estabilidad adicionales por conquista de ciudad

TEXT.Russian: [ICON_BULLET]Нет отрицательных очков Стабильности от городов под оккупацией
TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET]No negative Stability Points from cities under occupation
TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]Pas de points de stabilité négatifs pour les villes occupées
TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET]Nessun punto stabilitа negativo in caso di cittа occupate.
TEXT.Spanish: [ICON_BULLET]No hay puntos de estabilidad negativos por las ciudades sometidas a ocupaciуn

TEXT.Russian: [ICON_BULLET]Нет штрафок к стабильности за малый объ¸м торговли
TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET]No negative Stability Points for low amount of traded resources
TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]Pas de points de stabilité négatifs pour un faible niveau de ressources échangées
TEXT.German: [ICON_BULLET]Keine Stabilitätspunktabzüge durch eine geringe Anzahl gehandelter Ressourcen
TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET]Nessun punto stabilitа negativo in caso di scarso commercio di risorse.
TEXT.Spanish: [ICON_BULLET]No hay puntos de estabilidad negativos por baja cantidad de recursos intercambiados

TEXT.Russian: [ICON_BULLET]Нет штрафок в Стабильности за неразвитую экономику
TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET]No negative Stability Points for poor economy
TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]Pas de points de stabilité négatifs pour une économie pauvre
TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET]Nessun punto stabilitа negativo in caso di scarsa economia.
TEXT.Spanish: [ICON_BULLET]No hay puntos de estabilidad negativos por economнa dйbil

TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]Risque de Grande Dépression
TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET]Rischio di Grande Depressione.
TEXT.Spanish: [ICON_BULLET]Riesgo de Gran Depresiуn

TEXT.Russian: [ICON_BULLET]Не более одной корпорации на город[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Пост-коммунистический кризс в случае смены экономической системы
TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET]No more than one corporation per city[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Post-communist crisis in case of economic system switch
TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]Crise post-communiste en cas de changement de système économique
TEXT.German: [ICON_BULLET]Maximal eine Kapitalgesellschaft pro Stadt[ICON_BULLET][ICON_BULLET]Post-kommunistische Krise im Falle eines Wirtschaftssystemwechsels
TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET]Crisi post-comunista in caso di cambio di sistema economico.
TEXT.Spanish: [ICON_BULLET]Crisis post-comunista en caso de cambio de sistema econуmico

TEXT.Russian: [ICON_BULLET] Временная нестабильности при переходе к демократии
TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET]Temporary instability caused by transition to Democracy
TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]Instabilité temporaire causée par la transition vers la Démocratie
TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET]Instabilitа temporanea causata dal passaggio alla democrazia.
TEXT.Spanish: [ICON_BULLET]Inestabilidad temporal causada por la transiciуn a la democracia

TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]Allows construction of classical wonders
TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET]Allows construction of classical wonders
TEXT.Spanish: [ICON_BULLET]Allows construction of classical wonders

TEXT.Russian: Дополнительные очки Стабильности за каждого вассала
TEXT.English: Adds a Stability Points bonus for each vassal
TEXT.French: Ajoute un bonus de points de stabilité par vassal
TEXT.Italian: Aggiunge un punto stabilitа per ogni vassallo.
TEXT.Spanish: Aсade una bonificaciуn de puntos de estabilidad por cada vasallo

TEXT.Russian: Adds a Stability Points bonus for each civilization starting point controlled
TEXT.English: Adds a Stability Points bonus for each civilization starting point controlled
TEXT.French: Ajoute un bonus de points de stabilité par point de départ de civilisation contrôlé
TEXT.Italian: Aggiunge un punto stabilitа per ogni punto di avvio di civiltа controllato.
TEXT.Spanish: Aсade una bonificaciуn de puntos de estabilidad por cada punto de inicio de civilizaciуn controlado

TEXT.Russian: Добавляет очки Стабильности за каждый город, основанный на расстоянии не менее 15 клеток от столицы.
TEXT.English: Adds a Stability Points bonus for each city founded at least 15 tiles from the capital
TEXT.French: Ajoute un bonus de points de stabilité par ville fondée à 15 cases ou plus de la capitale
TEXT.German: Stabilitätspunktbonus für jede Stadt, die mindestens 15 Geländefelder von der Hauptstadt entfernt gegründet wurde
TEXT.Italian: Aggiunge un bonus di punti stabilitа per ogni cittа fondata ad almeno 15 caselle dalla capitale.
TEXT.Spanish: Aсade una bonificaciуn de puntos de estabilidad por cada ciudad fundada al menos a 15 casillas de la capital

TEXT.Russian: Adds a Stability Points bonus on city conquest; no negative Stability Points from cities under occupation
TEXT.English: Adds a Stability Points bonus on city conquest; no negative Stability Points from cities under occupation
TEXT.French: Ajoute un bonus de points de stabilité par ville conquise ; pas de points de stabilité négatifs pour les villes occupées
TEXT.German: Stabilitätspunktbonus bei Stadteroberung; keine Stabilitätspunktabzüge durch besetzte Städte
TEXT.Italian: Aggiunge un bonus di punti stabilitа per la conquista di cittа; nessun punto stabilitа negativo in caso di cittа occupate.
TEXT.Spanish: Aсade una bonificaciуn de puntos de estabilidad por conquista de ciudades; no hay puntos de estabilidad negativos por las ciudades sometidas a ocupaciуn

TEXT.Russian: No negative Stability Points for low amount of traded resources; no negative Stability Points for poor economy
TEXT.English: No negative Stability Points for low amount of traded resources; no negative Stability Points for poor economy
TEXT.French: Pas de points de stabilité négatifs pour un faible niveau de ressources échangées ; pas de points de stabilité négatifs pour une économie pauvre
TEXT.German: Keine Stabilitätspunktabzüge durch geringfügig gehandelte Ressourcen; keine Stabilitätspunktabzüge durch schlechte Wirtschaftslage
TEXT.Italian: Nessun punto stabilitа negativo in caso di scarso commercio di risorse; nessun punto stabilitа negativo in caso di scarsa economia.
TEXT.Spanish: No hay puntos de estabilidad negativos por baja cantidad de recursos intercambiados; no hay puntos de estabilidad negativos por economнa dйbil

TEXT.Russian: Extra stability from controlling foreign cores; reduced likeliness of respawns on your territory
TEXT.English: Extra stability from controlling foreign cores; reduced likeliness of respawns on your territory

TEXT.Russian: [ICON_BULLET]Дополнительная стабильность за контроль над чужой родной территорией[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Меньше вероятность перерождения цивилизации на Вашей территории
TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET]Extra stability for controlling foreign cores[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Reduced likeliness of respawns on your territory

TEXT.Russian: [ICON_BULLET]Can convert production to commerce with %D1_Mod%% efficiency
TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET]Can convert production to commerce with %D1_Mod%% efficiency

TEXT.Russian: [ICON_BULLET]%D1_Change free specialist for all cities within the third ring of your capital
TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET]%D1_Change free specialist for all cities within the third ring of your capital
Extra happiness from military units, faster construction of Wonders
May hire double the amount of Statesmen, extra happiness in the largest cities, extra happiness from Courthouses
No city distance maintenance, extra happiness from military units, extra espionage from specialists
May hire double the amount of Artists, Scientists, Engineers, extra production from Towns, unhappiness from civs without Egalitarianism
Extra experience for units, extra commerce from Forts, extra happiness from Castles
Extra production and commerce in your Capital
Can draft two units per turn, increased Great General birth rate, extra happiness from Barracks
Increased Worker work rate, extra production from Pastures, extra commerce from Farms
Extra commerce from Towns, extra trade route yield, can spend gold to finish building construction

TEXT.Russian: Можно жертвовать населением городов для завершения производства
TEXT.English: Can sacrifice city population to finish production
Increased Great People birth rate, increased Cottage growth
Extra food from specialists if city works less than seven tiles, increased number of cities maintenance
No additional income from foreign trade routes, extra income from trade through your Capital, extra commerce from Plantations, faster construction of Customs Houses
Extra trade route in all cities, increased corporation commerce

TEXT.Russian: No maintenance penalty for distance to Palace
TEXT.English: No maintenance penalty for distance to Palace

TEXT.Russian: Increased food production from workshops and watermills; extra production from specialists; production converted into more commerce
TEXT.English: Increased food production from workshops and watermills; extra production from specialists; production converted into more commerce
Reduced unhealthiness in all cities, extra commerce from Windmills, Watermills, Forest Preserves, extra happiness from Public Transportation, faster construction of Recycling Centers and Hydro Plants
Can build classical wonders, extra happiness from Pagan Temples, extra unhappiness from non-state religions
Cities with state religion construct buildings faster, extra unhappiness from non-state religions
Cities with state religion train units faster, no spread of non-state religions, extra unhappiness from non-state religions
May hire double the amount of Priest specialists, extra unit experiences in cities with state religion, extra happiness in cities with state religion, extra unhappiness from non-state religions
Increased Great People birth rate in cities with state religion, can train Missionaries without Monasteries, extra unhappiness from non-state religions
No state religion, no unhappiness from non-state religions, increased scientific research

TEXT.Russian: [SPACE]на специалиста для каждого города, который обрабатывает не больше %d1 клеток суши
TEXT.English: [SPACE]per Specialist for every city that works at most %d1 land tiles
TEXT.German: [SPACE]pro Spezialist für jede Stadt, die höchstens %d1 Landfelder bearbeitet

TEXT.Russian: Can Spend Gold to Finish Building Production in a City
TEXT.English: Can Spend Gold to Finish Building Production in a City

TEXT.Russian: Can Spend Gold to Finish Military Unit Production in a City
TEXT.English: Can Spend Gold to Finish Military Unit Production in a City

TEXT.Russian: [ICON_BULLET]No stability penalty for conquered cities or minority culture
TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET]No stability penalty for conquered cities or minority culture

TEXT.Russian: [ICON_BULLET]Can Build All Wonders that Require a State Religion
TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET]Can Build All Wonders that Require a State Religion
